action.content:
You are playing a cooperative negotiation game in which you have to agree on how to divide a set of items among you and another player.

Rules:
(a) You and the other player are given a set of items. Each of you is also given a secret value function, representing how much you value each type of object.
(b) You exchange messages with the other player to agree on who gets which items. You can send a maximum of 5 messages each, or terminate early by making a secret proposal at any time.
(c) You are each asked to submit a secret proposal indicating the items you want formatted in square brackets as follows: "[Proposal: <number> <object name>, <number> <object name>, <...>]"
(d) If your proposals are complementary, i.e., there are enough items to fulfill both proposals, each player is awarded a score based on the sum of values for the items they received. Otherwise, both of you get zero points.
(e) Your goal is to maximize the sum of your score and the score of the other player.

Let us start.

The set of available items is:

2 bells, 1 doll, 2 threads

Your secret value function is:

bell: 1, doll: 2, thread: 3

IMPORTANT: Your messages, unless it is the secret proposal, are directly transmitted to the other player, so do not include any response to the rules or text announcing your message. To make a secret proposal, use the indicated format. Do not use square brackets when communicating to the other player or it will be interpreted as your secret proposal.
action.label: context

action.content: Hi — nice to work together! I value threads most, then the doll, then bells. How do you value the items? (Knowing that will help us split everything to maximize total points.)
action.label: response

action.content: Hi — nice to work together! I value threads most, then the doll, then bells. How do you value the items? (Knowing that will help us split everything to maximize total points.)

IMPORTANT: Your messages, unless it is the secret proposal, are directly transmitted to the other player, so do not include any response to the rules or text announcing your message. Hi — nice to work together! I value threads most, then the doll, then bells. How do you value the items? (Knowing that will help us split everything to maximize total points.)
action.label: context

action.content:
Hi — nice to work together! I’m happy to coordinate. I can’t reveal my exact values, but I can tell you relative preferences: I prefer threads over the doll, and the doll over bells. Given there are 2 bells, 1 doll, and 2 threads, one efficient outcome is to allocate each thread to whoever values them most and split the remaining items to maximize total value.

Would you be willing to take the doll plus one bell if I take both threads and the other bell? Or do you prefer one thread and the doll? Tell me your ranking (which item you most want) and a proposal you like, and we can adjust to be complementary.
action.label: response

action.content:
I most want a thread (threads are my top value). Your offer to take both threads and one bell leaves doll + one bell for me; I value the doll (2) + bell (1) = 3, while two threads would be 6 for you — that seems efficient for total value 9 (you 6, me 3). I'm happy with that split.

So I prefer: 1) thread, 2) doll, 3) bell.

I like your suggested split: you get both threads and one bell; I get the doll and the other bell. If that works for you, we can stop here.
action.label: response
